Reviews.Title: Great point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Claire Jordan "Filmmaker - "The Baroness ...

} // ]]> var cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81I4adqWQ5S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay) { cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81I4adqWQ5S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81I4adqWQ5S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3MCU5AVGZVDVCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:46 MinsThis camera has many features to recommend it: the on/off button is secure so you can't accidentally turn it off when you're shooting (I've done that about a thousand times on my other cameras,) it's super-compact, has an optical telephoto lens, easy-to-navigate menus, and decent battery life. But the thing that's most important to me: can I use it without worrying about which setting it's on? Yep, I can. It's a solid point-and-shooter. You can set it on auto and it will take very nice pictures without the need for any fuddling with the menus.The video shows the quality of the photos. They were taken at a New Orleans house museum where the lighting is varied and can be a little tricky. The photos look great, especially the ones of the spiral staircase. The detail is impressive. This is a great little camera.I do like the large lcd touchscreen on my older Fuji Z700, but the picture quality seems a little better on the Lumix, so it's destine to become the camera that I carry in my bag for instant use.

Reviews.Title: Compact Lumix is a Perfect Companion
Reviews.Author: TomK1 "tomk1"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH2 is a is part of the Lumix line of cameras.  Lumix cameras range from SLR-like sophistication to simple point and shoot meant for taking pictures of friends and family at get-togethers.  I've used cameras in the Lumix line for several years and I've always been pleased by quality of the pictures.  For some reason, the pictures from a Lumix really "pop" compared to other cameras.The DMC-FH2 is consistent with other Lumix cameras.  There are multiple scene modes available for control of your pictures, generally, you choose Intelligent Auto (IA) when you want to camera to choose the correct combination of flash, depth of field, focus points, and shutter speed.  You can also manually choose how the camera will operate based on scene type such as portrait, night photography, or landscape (there are many variations).Unlike others cameras in the Lumix line, this does not have a dedicated mode button; that is done scrolling through options on the screen.  The main disadvantage of this approach is that instead of a dedicated movie button, you must scroll to the correct mode on the screen.  I found this inconvenient and does not lend itself to quickly jumping into movie mode when the need arises.The zoom range isn't particularly wide at 5x, but given the compact dimensions of this camera, its reasonable.  It's sufficient for most uses, although it may leave you wishing for more range if you're travelling.  On the other hand, the zoom button is positioned nicely, so it's very easy to quickly frame your picture.  Shutter lag is non-existent.  The rest of the controls are consistent with the Panasonic line from the last 4-5 years which is a good thing.  All in all, the experience using it is overwhelmingly positive.The pictures themselves are excellent and well lit using either natural light or the fill-flash.  The 14M pixels (!) give you plenty pixels to blow-up, crop, or do editing, but keep in mind this is a small camera with a tiny lens, so don't expect to get sharp pictures if you blow the pictures up on your PC.  For most uses, I don't believe this will be an issue.Movies mode is a bit disappointing.  In addition to the control problems I mentioned previously, the camera will not zoom in or out once you start taking the movie.  Whatever the zoom position was when you started taking the movie, thats what you'll get.  I can't figure out why they added this limitation (motor noise from the zoom perhaps?), but its particularly frustrating and makes the movie function significantly less useful.  The good news is the movies are in QuickTime .mov format so should be readable and editable on either PC's or Macs in almost any picture or movie editing software.The screen, like all new Lumix cameras is big, bright and useful to determine if your last pictures was blurry.  Whatever Panasonic uses as the material for this screen is very scratch resistant.  I always carry the Lumix cameras in my pocket with no cover and the screens have never scratched.Battery life seems reasonable.  In standby mode, the batteries do not drain away too quickly, and in general use where you take 1-2 pictures, turn off the camera, then shut it off and repeat, I was able to go an entire weekend travelling and at party taking about 150 pictures and the camera's battery indicator showed full.In summary, this is a compact, well made camera that is perfect to carry along in a shirt pocket when a bulkier camera doesn't make sense.  If your photographic needs are simple, its a great one-and-only camera.  It has all the usual goodness of the Lumix line (sharp pictures, vibrant colors), an IA mode that will suit 90% of all point-and-shoot needs.  And the ability to manually choose a scene mode when the IA system isn't doing what you need.Pros:1) Consistently excellent pictures2) Small, compact3) Beautifully made4) Ease of use5) Intelligent Auto (IA) makes photography easy6) Control system maturityCons:1) No zoom in movie mode2) No dedicated movie button3) Somewhat limited zoom range

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Grant
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the main intention of using it for digiscoping with a Vortex Razor spotting scope. The camera worked excellent for this purpose, no vignetting, easy to change ISO setting and it takes bright crisp images through the scope. I also have been using it as a pocket point and shoot camera and the pictures it takes are amazing. Macro shots of spring flowers are bright and crisp and I have taken some of my best coastal sunset pictures with this camera using the sunset feature. My other camera is a Nikon Coolpix S6000 and the Lumix has became my go to camera.Battery life seems good but I wish that it could be charged using the USB cable. You have to take the battery out of the camera and insert it into the wall charger.One reviewer said they had difficulty viewing the LCD screen on a bright day. I live in Nevada and we have a lot of bright days and I haven't had any trouble viewing the screen.I would recommend this camera for everyday general use and digiscoping.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Odds
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera, so my #1 priority was to find a camera that was easy to use. The DMC-FH2 was just what I was looking for:- Small and lightweight, you can take it on the go just about anywhere (It's smaller and weighs less than my cell phone!).- It boots up and focuses quickly, so you can snap shots on the move without having to stop and wait for any longer than it takes you to press the shoot button.- The IA takes all the work out of taking decent (not blurry, not too dark, etc.) shots. There are various modes for taking better shots, but for my purposes the IA is perfect!- The battery life seems excellent. I took over 250 photos and shot a 30 second video and the battery still registered full. That seemed a little strange to me, since reviews had it pegged at an average of 270 shots before the battery runs down. But maybe my habit of quickly snapping shots extends the battery life?I took this camera on a day hike the other day and took over 250 photos with it. I only had to delete a couple due to blurriness. Most of my shots I simply pulled the camera out of my pocket, paused long enough to take the shot, and kept moving. Often I was barely waiting for the UI to show up on the LCD before shooting, but it seemed to handle it just fine. Now I have tons of stuff to share with friends and family on facebook!My only criticism is that the LCD isn't very helpful. I didn't even bother checking what my pictures looked like. The sun was too bright and the screen too small to really tell whether I got the shot. But I guess that's what you get with such a small camera. Not a big deal. Like I said, you won't have to worry about the IA not focusing properly and the image stabilization appears to work near-perfectly as well. So if you point the camera in the proper direction, you should get more or less what you're looking for!If you're looking for professional quality photos, this probably isn't the camera for you. But if you want a cheap compact camera for the purpose of taking shots on the go, then this one deserves a look. It helps that the price is pretty low, too!

Reviews.Title: Lumix love
Reviews.Author: tirah
Reviews.Content: i own a Lumix LX3 and wanted to try another Lumix. This time i need an ultra compact, because i bought a Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Pink) from amazon recently but i ended up returning it because of the lens error. i wanted to purchase another one but the price went from 109 to 199!!! ridiculous.  Then i came upon this beauty here that they call the Lumix Fh2.  Im liking it so far, it looks great and works great.  There is no lag when you take a picture, which I noticed on the Canon.  The screen is crisp and clear. It's very light and thin.  I think it is a solid camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly
Reviews.Author: rogloretta
Reviews.Content: We purchased five Panasonic Lumix cameras to be used by our junior high students to take pictures for our school website at various events as well as pictures for our annual school video yearbook.  The students enjoy the cameras, they are easy to use and the pictures always turn out very clear.  I would highly recommend this product.Loretta L BlanchardLake Pleasant Central School

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: Meredith McMillan
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed. I was worried when I didn't see many reviews for this camera so I took a couple days to do some research and I couldn't find a bad review anywhere. I got the camera and am so glad I did. I have been using it for two days now since I got it. At first I was a bit disappointed that to charge the battery you had to take it out and put it in the charger but after really thinking about it (and doing it twice) it dawned on me how nice that is if you have more than one battery, you can charge one and use the other. Charging them doesn't take long either. It is slimmer than I expected, perfect size. The resolution is fabulous, the modes are great. I have already taken some of my favorite pictures ever. Mid-range camera with high-end features. HIGHLY recommended!

Reviews.Title: That's The One
Reviews.Author: M. Gerrish
Reviews.Content: I like a pocket camera, mostly because phone cameras are really only good for recording a fender bender, and because it isn't always convenient to tote a big DSLR around (especially since I keep a long lens in place). I can discreetly pull a pocket camera from my purse and get a close-up of the fabulous anniversary dinner at the swanky restaurant. Or a great shot of me and my sibs at a backyard barbecue.In theory.Problem is, those shots generally require a flash, which I really dislike, so I lose a lot of shots to "dim light-blur." I hate it when that happens. So I lusted for a better pocket camera.I don't care about digital zoom. Megapixels? At this point, unless you're shooting for billboards, anything over 10mp is more than enough. I don't care if a camera has a front facing window to see myself while I apparently take a picture of me. What? And I don't need any auto-upload feature to a social networking site.I want enough sensor punch to work well in dim light. I want it to do a superb job with macro so I can zero in on the food! (I love food shots, such great memories.) I don't want a load of pixel "noise" getting in the way in any circumstance. And I want it to fit comfortably in my pocket or purse.So the Panasonic Lumix enters. After charging the battery, I went into a closet, set the camera on macro and took a closeup of the stitching on a suitcase. As one would expect, the photo was horribly underexposed, practically black. But using graphics software, I lifted the exposure and I was delighted to see that the stitching was in focus. Dark closet. Tiny subject. In focus. Imagine if I cared about the stitching! This is excellent, because my former pocket camera would automatically slow the shutter speed (no choice on my part) to allow enough light to get the shot, but without a tripod, the blur would make the shot useless.I quibble with this -- when I took indoor action shots of my grandson with the camera set on Intelligent Scene (auto-mode), his skin didn't look pixelated, but weirdly mottled. I had much better results by manually selecting the scene. There are many scene options and they all seem to work really well. Even in dim light! And it does a great job of stopping a moving target (did I mention the grandson?).The Lumix is small, about the size of my smart phone, but the view screen is large enough and you can zoom in during playback to make sure you got the shot you want. The controls are self-explanatory and easy to operate. I did not load any of the software into my computer, but simply connected the camera to my PC with the supplied USB and the drivers loaded automatically. Of course it will connect to an ordinary tripod (if one must).Oh, the flash, you ask? It's just as unpleasant as the flash on every pocket camera, although it's a quick couple of flicks to turn it on or off. And using the option to avoid red-eye (instead of full-on flash) dims the flash just enough to be not entirely hideous. Presto!Even at a higher price point, this camera is a great deal. Start shooting!

Reviews.Title: Veeeery nifty wittle Point & Shoot camera thingy
Reviews.Author: P. STEWART "Patrick Stewart (NOT the Star Tre...
Reviews.Content: The Deal:I was lucky enough to get this little camera for around $85.00 here on Amazon. (Chose the red one btw.) I think I made a very good selection. Not only was that a great price but it's also a great camera. If you need a basic (with some cool bells & whistles) point & shooter and don't want to spend toooo much...this is the perfect one to consider.Construction & Durability:Can't obviously comment on the life & complete durability of it yet since I've only had it since January of 2012. But, so far so good. It's constructed well and feels very solid. I think the shell is probably made of anodized aluminum. The buttons and switches all feel durable. I have to say that I really love having a switch instead of a button to power on the camera too. For me that's a plus.Speed:It's a very fast camera. All the functions (processing, flash recharge, etc.) work smoothly & quickly. It's...sparky!Battery Life:When taking pics at the highest setting (14MP) and with IA (Intelligent Auto) engaged it gets very good battery life with the included 680mAh, 3.6V one. For taking HD videos however...that's what sucks the power cell fast. You'll definitely need a higher capacity battery (& maybe an extra just in case) to shoot a significant amount of video. Unfortunately the Panasonic batteries are not cheap. Fortunately I did find a great 3rd party replacement for it from Wasabi. It's double the capacity and not very costly. Seen it for $8.99 with free shipping. Works perfectly and "feels" like the original battery too. Here's the link--Wasabi Power Battery for Panasonic DMW-BCK7, DMW-BCK7E, DMW-BCK7PP, NCA-YN101F, NCA-YN101G, NCA-YN101H, Lumix DMC-FH2, DMC-FH5, DMC-FH7, DMC-FH25, DMC-FH27, DMC-FP5, DMC-FP7, DMC-FS16, DMC-FS18, DMC-FS22, DMC-FS35, DMC-FS37, DMC-FX77, DMC-FX78, DMC-FX90...Picture & Video:It takes very crisp & clear photos and the 720p HD videos look great. As for it not taking good pictures in low light like some have suggested...I'd say you're not adjusting the camera correctly or using the proper IA mode. Plus, low light pics can be kind of a crap shoot with MOST cameras, from cheaper point & clickers to expensive SLR's. For a below $200.00 camera this sucker does pretty well in my opinion.Memory Cards & Stuff:Since it only comes with a piffly 70 megabytes built in you'll need a good memory card. I'd recommend Kingston or Sandisk cards. Neither of those have failed me yet. Also you'll need to get at least a Class 4 card if you're going to be shooting video with this thing. The documentation recommends Class 6 or higher but I've found that the 4 is fast enough to catch the video. The HD movie mode shoots at about 30 Frames Per Second. According to the people who know about this kinda stuff, Class 4 is perfect for 30 FPS videos. For more than 30 you'll need higher. Oh yeah...and class 4 cards are still much cheaper than 6 & up. (Hey, I'm trying to help you to save money here. LOL.) This is the one I chose to use--SanDisk Flash 16 GB SDHC Flash Memory Card SDSDB-016GAccessories & Stuff:Need a nice protective red case for your red camera? This is the one I bought. It's red, rugged, semi-hard and it fits PERFECTLY! (Wow...that sounded...bad. But it WAS an accurate description.) CaseCrown Compact Travel Case (Crimson) for Canon PowerShot SD3500IS 14.1 MP Digital CameraIf I learn anything else about this camera I'll try to update my review for ya. Any questions? Feel free to ask. If I have answers I'll give 'em as fast as I can. Ok now, you have some shopping to do. Good luck and have fun!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner Camera
Reviews.Author: Allan Liska
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 9 year old and he loves it.  He is just getting into photography and the camera helps him take great pictures. Images are crisp and the stability feature keeps them fom blurring.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, portability... not so sure about the battery.
Reviews.Author: Rhianna Walker "The geek mom and book blogger...
Reviews.Content: I'm no photographer. Never taken a class. Never owned a particularly expensive camera. But everyone needs a point-and-shoot even in this age of cell phone cameras. For years I've been a Canon Powershot user. My second is still in good working order and in spite of its bulk I will continue using it. I was really excited, however, to give the Panasonic Lumix a try. It has lots of features my old Powershot just doesn't have and double the MP.As just a point-and-shoot the Lumix is very easy to use. It's easy to take great photos without much more than pressing the button. I do find that the auto-flash goes off considerably more often than I would like it to. Fortunately it's easy to quickly turn it off.If you're interested in learning more about the art of photography it's also easy to change your other settings. I took some really cool pictures of my kids on Independence Day playing with sparklers and shooting off other fireworks. Snapping photos in the dark at a slower shutter speed was something I'd never been able to try with my previous cam because the screen is so small and the controls confusing. The Lumix is definitely user friendly in that department.The actual picture quality... honestly 14.1 MP is insanely big. I think that contributes to the slow speed of take and loading but the photos look great. I've taken several photos of things I wouldn't normally bother with just for the purpose of reviewing and plenty of shots of my toddler running around. Considering my lack of training in the do's and don't's of photography most of my photos have turned out really lovely. Outdoor shots come out vivid and crisp. Indoor shots occasionally have red-eye and not all motion shots come out great, but generally most are good. Going through about 250 photos I would say there are only about a dozen that aren't good based on technical issues (ie. red-eye, blurring, graininess).The Shake Detector and Image Stabilization is by far my favorite feature of the camera. I've had other cameras with this that did well but the Lumix's is by far superior. I have VERY shaky hands. Always have. It's frustrating when taking photos so this feature is the first thing I look at when camera shopping and I would recommend the Lumix based on this feature alone. It does make the camera slower to snap a photo and sucks up battery life but if you also suffer from severely shaky hands I can't recommend this camera enough.My only real deal-breaker, that would keep me (personally) from wanting to purchase this camera, is the rechargable battery. While it lasts quite a while I've had it run out when I was out at the park. Unlike other cameras I've had there's no quick replacement tucked away in my camera bag when I run out. That said it's obviously intended to make the camera thinner and lighter. That's definitely something you, as the consumer, have to make a choice on. I like the light, very portable size of the Lumix but am really forgetful about charging batteries so it loses a star for that.Overall this is a very good camera that takes beautiful pictures with minimal effort. I've been surprisingly impressed and begun to use my old camera less and less as I get used to this one. For taking 'still life' photos (as I do for my blogs and reviews from time to time) I've never had a camera compare even closely to this one. For the price range I think you're getting an exceptionally high quality camera and if it weren't for the battery not meeting my needs I could have said I loved it. Highly recommended for folks with shaky hands, who take a lot of outdoor photos or still object shots, or who desire portability and don't mind recharging the battery.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for On-the-Go!
Reviews.Author: JD Cetola
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic FH2 Lumix camera is one of the best I've seen/used when it comes to packing a punch in a small package.  This is a sleek and easy to transport camera--smaller than most phones (even flip phones).  It's easy to use and takes great pictures as well.  There is a lot to like and little to complain about:Likes--size (a huge plus, this really is a small camera), 14.1 Megapixels, 1280x720p HD video capable, on/off switch is difficult to accidentally trigger, battery life is excellent, 70MB built-in memory, Face Detection Auto Focus/Exposure feature (reduces blurring due to focus on other objects), and Intelligent ISO Motion Detection Sensor (a nice feature that reduces blurring due to motion).Complaints--very few, but to get nitpicky, the 4X optical zoom is too weak, the LCD is often difficult to see in bright light (although it is a good size for this small camera), and access to video (as opposed to camera mode) takes a couple of steps.  As I said, these are very minor complaints.This is a great camera and is perfect for those who like to take their camera everywhere.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: My first Lumix survived a mountain fall
Reviews.Author: B. Kemper "Buzz"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Lumix. This brand has earned my loyalty; let me tell you how. I was climbing the south couloir of Mount Quandary with a buddy. We were post-holing in deep early June snow (yes, we were using snowshoes, but still post-holing pretty badly), when my right foot sunk in fast; I was up to my crotch in snow and, in my flailing attempt to arrest my fall so I wouldn't start an uncontrolled fall down the mountain, I managed to knock my camera case loose from it's velcro strap and I watched helplessly as my Lumix tumbled down the south face, bouncing off the crusty snow all the way down. Having fought my way up that far (we were 3/4 the way to the summit at this point), I was not about to go down and get it, so I considered it lost. Well, my buddy looked at 14ers.com the next day and lo and behold, a climber had found my camera, with no case in sight, sticking out of the snow. I called him to ID my camera and he told me it still worked! I picked it up the next day (luckily the guy lived near Denver), and sure enough, IT WORKED. I used that camera for another 3 years before it finally started to give up the ghost, and I bought a new one a month ago. So far, so good on this one; it works as well as the previous one, and is smaller and lighter to boot. And it still features the high-quality Leica lens that the previous one had. So I do recommend this camera, folks. If it can survive a tumbling plummet down a Colorado 14er, it can take just about anything you can dish out.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: David Norville
Reviews.Content: Bought this product for my dad who isnt very tech savvy at all and who was going overseas on a vacation particularly because of the easy to use reviews. He was able to take many pics and videos fairly easily and loved it. He lost the charger and battery and its been a bit of a challenge to find replacements on amazon. Overall a good product though

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Joyce Massar
Reviews.Content: So far I like the camera. I had another Lumix that got dirt in it and we couldn't fix it. I liked that model of Lumix better than this one. This model is not as sturdy and actually feels kind of cheap in comparison. The pictures are great that come out of it so I guess that's all that matters. Has all the features of the other Lumix that I had so if it lasts as long I will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Kelly
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a professional photographer or even an enthusiast--I just like to take pictures of my family and places we have been to capture our time together, at home and on vacation.This is the perfect camera for that job.  The picture quality is excellent, whether taking closeups or views from the top of a mountain.  At first, I stuck with the basic modes, and then started to discover some really great features.  I particularly liked the "panorama assist", which allows you to knit together several adjacent images for a wide scene.  The absolute best feature (which I did not know existed, but was so thankful later that it does) is that when taking a video, the camera makes a still picture of the initial shot.  On a number of occasions, I mistakenly left the camera in video mode and wanted to take a still shot, and I got my still shot anyway.The only knock I have on this camera is the small amount of built-in memory--they tout the 70 MB of built-in memory as if this somehow a great feature.  At 2+ MB per image, you will burn through that in no time, so you will have to buy a separate flash card.  I am quite puzzled as to why camera manufacturers do not spend the extra two dollars it would cost to throw a 4 GB chip in the package.

Reviews.Title: Why new battery size?
Reviews.Author: A. Rosen "internet shopper"
Reviews.Content: My prior model lumix went bad and cost as much to fix as a new one so went with same model (upgraded) since I had extra batteries. They are not the same!  Bummer.  Nevertheless, the camera does what I want.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with low light. What's up with small point and shoots these days?
Reviews.Author: Michele
Reviews.Content: After having owned Sony Cybershot point-and-shoots exclusively for the past few years (in addition to a DSLR Canon RebelX) I decided to try a new brand because the current line of small Sony cams are mysteriously way worse in quality than what's come before. I just got this Lumix today and have been fiddling with it in low light situations and it's nowhere near the quality of the older model Cybershots, which created much more sensitive images without the big grain/mottling I'm seeing in the Lumix. With the old Cybershots I could blow up the images on my computer monitor and see that they were soft and somewhat grainy due to the lack of light, but the Lumix images have major grain and in general it's harder to get a good low light shot with it. The Lumix is better than the Sony (DSC-W510 is the one I tested most recently) but still much worse than previous Cybershots I purchased 2, 4, 6 years ago.That said I haven't had this camera long enough to learn all its quirks, but so far this has been another in a line of recent disappointments with what point-and-shoot small digital cameras are available right now.Thinking maybe I should have gone with a comparably-priced Canon? Some of the images I'm getting from this are more comparable to what I can get from a really good/lucky shot on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures outdoors, not so great indoors
Reviews.Author: Shevi "FantasyWeaver"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWV', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81iObetq-CS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81iObetq-CS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVcurrentClick) { return cv_mo6LMLC1V8WRWVcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:02 MinsThis camera is compact, very reasonably priced for such a high megapixel camera, and very easy to use. The pictures it takes outdoors or in a sunlit room are brilliant. The details and color are gorgeous. On the other hand, indoor shots in normal indoor lighting conditions (away from a sunny window) come out splotchy and sometimes tinted. Flash helps indoors, but only if the thing you're trying to take a picture of is 5-10 feet away. I have several cameras and am still looking for a digital one that takes perfect indoor shots under normal lighting conditions, but compared to what's already available, this is a great camera at a great price for taking pictures outdoors.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing x 2
Reviews.Author: Steve Basile
Reviews.Content: Within the first ten shots the camera died. Amazon did a product exchange within days.Second camera has serious low light issues. Grainy like a cheap cell phone. Low light is supposedly one of the strengths of this camera.So one of these things is true: 1. another defective unit or 2. the camera really stinks in low light. Either way does not reflect well on Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: It an ok snap and shoot backup
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Israel
Reviews.Content: This is one of those digital cameras where you find yourself thinking that it is ok ... For the price.On a plus side it is a pretty good form factor, small enough to carry, big enough to use.  I personally dislike not having a traditional viewfinder but this seems to be coming more common place.I expected terrible shutter lag but was pleasantly surprised.  The zoom is also quick and provides a decent range.Photos in most conditions are not bad but in very bright sunlight they seem to get overexposed and look a bit washed out.I find myself using this when I do not want to lug the Canon dslr.  It is great for quick int and shoot, certainly far better than most cell phone cameras.  If it were my only small camera I would probably stick with canon.  Likewise, if you are taking that dream vacation, there is no substitute for a big lens and you should really be looking at a dslr.The key on this unit is that it is very reasonably priced.  It may not be the best on the market but Value for the dollar is very high.  I would take this over one of the secondary brands any day.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Dane "On Line Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera quite a bit and love the weight as size, the simplicity of use and the quality of photos.

Reviews.Title: A solid, simple camera.
Reviews.Author: squashpup "squashpup"
Reviews.Content: This thing is so compact that you forget you have it.  Picture quality is good, but I'd rather see fewer megapixels and greater ISO sensitivity.  That said, it's a point and shoot camera, and most of the time you'll get good pictures.I like cameras that let me adjust shutter and aperture manually, and this camera doesn't.  However, the scene modes let you have a greater degree of control over camera settings than the regular Program mode.  It'll do in a pinch, but I'd rather be able to fine tune those settings myself.It's a good camera for the money, nice and compact, with a great wide-angle lens which doesn't distort or blur at the fringes.  If you're a casual snapshooter, this camera will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Had this camera for a couple of years
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is so light and compact and easy to travel with. The price was a major selling point. The only negative is I wish you could focus while taking video. But that is a minor thing. Takes awesome pictures!

Reviews.Title: for the price; best in it.s class
Reviews.Author: e. patrick
Reviews.Content: my only complaint is too many settings for an occasional amatuer photographer like myself. I need to know my environment in advance. I am a product designer by trade and shoot either 'incognito' or 4' x 4' set design of a new prototype for inter office correspondence...

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mea Aparicio
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was small and it was pink. I take it horse back riding with me. It takes excellent pictures and has a pretty good zoom. It is very thin and fits in small bags or pockets nicely. This is the best vacation camera.

Reviews.Title: great lil camera
Reviews.Author: katz
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now for a long time. Just actually learned some new tricks to it. I loves the extra long battery life. Grandson loves taking pics with it now and I still uses it some has excellent quality pics.

Reviews.Title: It's a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ronnie
Reviews.Content: Really I don't have a lot to say. The price was phenomenal, and it uses a standard SD card. It's a very high quality camera for a non-professional like me.

Reviews.Title: Nice, compact, well built, good overall performance
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic FH2 is affordable, has a nice design, EZ to navigate system and slips in any pocket or purse. This camera does not offer HDMI output to TV but does have AV connection as well as PC -USB cord.  Does not re-charge from the USB cable however. So there are affordable plug-in chargers inexpensively you can obtain. Screen is small, but high quality 2.5 LCD screen. Playback of video or pictures are nice, and optical zoom is also good but you need to pre-zoom and then what ever choice you've made is locked in for video capture. Not a bad camera and great size. Sleek, thin.  Additional batteries also are affordable thru Amazon and offer higher power capacity than the manufacturer's.  Nice point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality.
Reviews.Author: maddylynn
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Panasonic Lumix that I had before, wasn't this model but similar. The quality of this is poor. Pictures were of poor quality and blurry, never clear like some of the comparable cameras out there in this price range. Sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for great price
Reviews.Author: Lauren DesJardins
Reviews.Content: This camera was reasonably priced and great quality. The pictures turn out very nicely both uploaded to my computer and in print. It came with all accessories listed and the wall charger is a must vs using batteries. I use it indoors, outdoors etc. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who needs a camera to use for anything recreational.

Reviews.Title: After 14 months spots started to appear on pictures seems to be issue internal to camera
Reviews.Author: skatch
Reviews.Content: I was happy with camera up until 14 months when spots started to appear on pictures seems like every month another spot appears. You see in lcd view finder & when you take picture they appear. I had lens cleaned but issue seems to be internal. I never had a camera that was useless after a little over a year. As usual things are made to break these days. Stay away from Lumix

Reviews.Title: CUTE AND COMPACT
Reviews.Author: toolman
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a gift for my grand daughter and I think it will be perfect for what she is requesting from it

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: shell shell mom of 4
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the size and price. I have a large sony $500 camera, but i carry this little one with me every where it takes pretty good pics, i have used it indoors outdoors for sports with kids and im very happy.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH2 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: In the AmaZone...
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I need it to do, plus more to be quite honest. The 4x optical zoom gives a better quality zoom (before going into digital zoom) than the 3x zoom I had on my last camera, especially at lower resolutions.  I found that for the majority of my photos, I was fine with the camera set at 7 megapixels or less for close subjects and indoor use.  This helped the write speed of the picture and reduce file size.  The 720p video capture is great too, but also more than I needed in close quarters and is hard on file size and battery life.  For the times that I did need to go beyond the 4x optical zoom into the digital zoom range (outdoors and covering longer distances), having the higher 14mp resolution, image stabilization and motion detection features came in very handy -and necessary- for zoomed in images that were not blurry from camera movement (which is greatly magnified with amount of zoom used).I recommend taking the time to really learn all the features and how to access them.  As an old manual 35mm SLR user, I found that I could better control the images when I manually adjusted the settings for live action and shutter speed, such as panning movement during sports or other live events.  I also recommend getting a very high speed memory card if you plan to shoot a lot of high-res pictures and video.  For most people, 14mp is overkill for birthday party snapshots (unless you plan to blow them up to mural size) when 3mp would do, but having the high resolution is great when shooting outdoors or at distances and wanting the ability to zoom into an area of the picture later and crop out the excess, without having to worry about image pixelation or graininess from over-zooming.  For a point-and-shoot camera, this Lumix has a lot of great features and probably more than the average user would ever use.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-FH2 - AVOID IT
Reviews.Author: Barbara Shaw
Reviews.Content: I bought the Lumix new in Hong Kong.  Paid too much, but liked the HD video feature.  Trouble is, the video uses up so much battery power you are dead in a few minutes.  Boo.  Also, the image quality at any light level and any amount of telephoto is seriously disappointing.  And up close, focus is always problematic.  Yeah, it may have a Leica lens but it can't do much good with it.  But what REALLY irks me is that 8 months after purchase the screen has two large black blotches that show up on the final image.  I have NOT dropped or abused this camera and am thinking it is a piece of JUNK.  I've had 3 small Canons and none of them had problems until I abused them, like dropped one in the sand and cleaned the inside myself...hahahaha.DON"T buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: David Stapleton
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this little camera. It is light, easy to use; the pictures are clear and detailed (at least to my eyes on a 1080p 32 inch TV that I use for a monitor).Pros:- great pictures (won't compete with an SLR)- quick response to picture taking- small, light weight- built in storage with ability to add an SD card- built in software that makes even me a good photographer- battery charge lasts for a good whileCons:- movie mode is limited to 720pI really had to struggle to find a fault. The camera is a good point and shoot device, suitable for personal use. P-)

Reviews.Title: pretty cool
Reviews.Author: Nalla Jodi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. Great pics and the stabilizer thing actually works. It so cute and small. Bought it as a gift for my sister and she absolutely loves it. The great test will come when we go on vacation :) We'll see if it can hold up to the debacle.

Reviews.Title: Great basic pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Layla Jane Anderson
Reviews.Content: easy to use and takes above average photos. Excellent compact size. Best camera i could hope to find for the price - definatley exceeded expectations

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: L. Sayan "artLover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my mother and she loves it.She needed a simple point and shoot with a big screen so that she could see  the photos. The screen size is great and the camera has a fast response. I also loved the nice pink color for her so that it is very personalized. So far she has said the camera has been great.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've been impressed with the quality of the Lumix series of cameras. The Leica lenses really give a quality and definition that you don't expect from such a small point and shoot. It's a lot easier to carry in a pocket than say my Canon 50D! This one has taken some exceptional macro shots, and really nice general shots. We like it!

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: OMG!  Finally a camera that takes a perfect picture every time!  This camera is compact, easy to use, lightweight with great picture quality.This is one of the few Amazon Vine Program products that I would actually purchase with my very own money.I would highly recommend it.  Thank you Amazon Vine.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Camera
Reviews.Author: DBR Chamber
Reviews.Content: So far so good!  We had a different brand camera that took low quality pictures.  We take pictures at the events we hold so we can put them on our website.  so far this camera has gone above and beyond our previous camera.  The price was right too.

Reviews.Title: Just what we wanted.
Reviews.Author: M. Rosenbaum "Michael I Rosenbaum"
Reviews.Content: Looking for a compact point/shoot to complement our Lumix G2. This little guy is really small, takes good pictures and is well priced for a 14mp camera with wide-angle capabilities. My wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Small but Powerful
Reviews.Author: Library Girl Reads
Reviews.Content: For such a small point and shoot, this camera is wonderful  It is extremely easy to use and the picture quality is stunning.  It is a 14MP camera, but it has the option to take widescreen 16:9 photos at 10.1MP.  It has built in presets that you can use, but the automatic setting does a great job so I didn't feel the need to use the specialized settings.The camera is incredibly light and easily fits into a pocket or purse.  It turns on very quickly and resets quickly so you don't have to wait long between pictures.The video quality on this camera is a huge improvement over our previous camera.This camera does have a few drawbacks, but these are to be expected from a point and shoot.  The zoom isn't that great so trying to get close up shots at the zoo would put you (and the zoo keepers) closer than you would want.  Also, night time pictures are extremely hard to get.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Becky Sue
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, especially the light weight.  The lens seems to take good pictures, and the intelligent setting works well.  I am disappointed in the zoom- it wasn't as powerful as I expected.  I read other reviews that said the battery didn't last long, but mine lasts through many, many pictures.  I wish they'd make the battery charger a little smaller though, to make it easier to carry with the camera.  Very low prices for all the features you get.

Reviews.Title: Loving it so far
Reviews.Author: Moonlight Graham "Ben"
Reviews.Content: For my job, I need to take quite a few photos.  They don't have to be particularly beautiful or spectacular, but they need to accurately show things when I'm on an inspection.  This camera seems to do the job a lot better than my old Sony 5 megapixel camera, which had a tendency of taking blurry photos from time to time.  I have had this camera for over a week now, and I have taken many photos in that time - not one blurry photo!  The camera itself is very easy to operate, although I haven't noticed anything that sets it apart from the competition as far as interface goes.  I have coupled it with the SanDisk 16gb Extreme 30MB/s Edition SDHC High Performance Card.  The camera only comes with 70 MB of internal storage, so you will have to get something.  Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera.  It's very light, turns on and off very quickly, and most importantly, appears to take very good photos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: D. Loza
Reviews.Content: We took it to our trip to Spain and everyone was amaze of the quality of the pictures. Is very small and full of cool features. Only neg is that the battery doesn't last long ( I took 1700 pictures on our 17 days in Spain) and because it was a new product I wasn't able to buy an extra battery (is not for sale yet). Other than that I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Magnum
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix is a great buy for anyone that wants a simple, use right out-of-the-box camera.  It is a simple point and shoot that will take pictures with a nice resolution.  It's slim and lightweight design will allows you to slip it right into a pocket or purse and have it at the ready for any photo taking opportunity.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera !
Reviews.Author: Groovin' guy "music historian"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH2 camera is fantastic and easy to use.It features a wide-angle lens. It has a 4x optical zoom. Thanks to a new mechanical design, it's very slim and travel friendly. It boasts an optical image stabilizer. It's an amazing testament of today's fascinating technology.The camera is able to record 14.1 mp photos and HD video !The internal memory is a bit small. I purchased a 4gGB SD HC card, (about 12$) to increase it's capacity.Pressing the "mode" button turns up 5 settings : . Intelligent Auto . Normal picture . Scene . Scene mode . Motion picture (video)Intelligent Auto is great for beginners, the camera functions automatically giving you a perfect shot. It features "picture burst" for multiple succession photography.. It features 4 color modes.The camera also displays scrolling messages (directions) that guide you along.It also automatically switches to "macro from auto focus when zooming in on a subject which is a great feature.I Exposure adjusts the picture when there is major contrast in the scene.I Resolution (intelligent resolution technology) provides sharp definition & resolution in the photo.There are 4 auto focus modes :1. Face detection2. AF tracking (locks in a moving subject)3. 11 Area (focuses on whole scene)4. 1 Area (focuses on objects in center)"Scene mode" contains 28 pre-set settings. Match the subject and recording situation, for example the flower icon will better focus a still, close image outdoors. (Experimenting with the different settings can be fun. I used the "Pin Hole" setting to reduce the glare from a gold dome on a building)  -------------------------------------Motion Picture mode can record 1280 x 720 videos as well as 2 lower resolution settings. You may zoom in while filming, but, the zoom cannot be changed once filming is started. There are setting that can be changed during filming which are; white balance, I Exposure, color modes and exposure !The LCD monitor operates in 4 settings which include:auto power (brightness adjusts automatically)power  (indoors or bright sun)high angleoffPhoto Fun Studio software is installed with the cd. Importing photos from camera to pc is easy, you do need to select one photo at a time. Photo editing has standard features and also "auto enhancement"I love the scrolling menu "helper" and am excited with all the camera's features. The camera is outstanding for the price. I wouldn't hesitate recommending it.

Reviews.Title: Good starter Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Howard W.
Reviews.Content: If you have been afraid of switching to digital photography because you love your drop in film and shoot camera, this Panasonic Lumix could be for you.I'm not going to even compare this to other digital cameras and their features.This digital camera is as close to a just "Point and Shoot" film camera as I have seen.It does have a very full area of options, but it is easy to choose a mode and just stay there.Others may say that all digital cameras have the automatic mode so you can point and shoot.  That is true, but how many times with those cameras have you accidentally gotten into a mode that isn't automatic and you can't get out?  This camera has so few modes that you almost cannot make a mistake.  It doesn't even have a format for the SD card.  Only delete single, multi and all.  You don't really need to know a lot to use this camera.The two main switches on/off, record/play are actually switches.  Which means they are either in the on or off, or play or record, not the "did I press that button or not" mode.I took over 100 test pictures.  They included: Full sunlight, shade, shade with fill flash, indoors, indoors with flash.  I tried different mega-pixel sizes of the images.Every shot was good, not great.  Not one of the pictures was truly super sharp.  I took a picture of a car across the street in full sunlight, zoomed in.  Viewing at 1:1 on my computer, I could easily read everything on the license plate, but there was no sharpness to the picture.  Everything was a little soft, like shooting through a very thin layer of gauze.No matter how easy a camera is to use, if it doesn't take good pictures, then it is not a good camera.  A lot of picture taking is the photographer.  A big responsibility of the photographer is not to move while taking the picture.  Sometimes that is very hard to small cameras or hard to press switches. For this camera, the "shutter release" is easy to press and it does have a built in image stabilizer.  But please understand that image stabilizers in cameras can do only so much, you still need to do your best to not shake the camera or the picture will still be blurry even with the stabilizer.  It was a little disappointing that I could not take what I thought should be a great picture.  While it could have been me, I am a semi-professional photographer and most of the time I know what I'm doing.Movie mode was similar.  The movie was good, not sharp.  You cannot zoom while in movie mode and the sound was actually pretty good.I want to conclude by saying this is an okay camera.  For Facebook, for emailing, soft pictures are fine, no one will even notice.  The only time you notice is when you zoom all the way in or make a large print.For the beginning digital photographer, this is a fine camera.

Reviews.Title: takes great pix/pink is awesome looking
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Morgan "JRCM27"
Reviews.Content: i had this cam in my wishlist&my; friend bought it for me i just got it shipped to me yesterday not sure how to use all the functions on it yet.however i love the pink one its not to bright just a perfect pink im happy my friend ended up buying this cam for me on here i love it=]

Reviews.Title: Not sturdy, suggest indoor use.
Reviews.Author: Steph "booklover"
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic works wonderfully!  Lightweight and small, this is great for travel plus easy to use.  The pictures look really good and it is first-rate for the price.I admit it, I really don't read instructions much when I first get an item.  Which often results in mini disasters since I am so lazy.  But in this case working with the camera was so intuitive that I still haven't read the instructions on working the camera.  The only problem for me was getting the battery in.  In that case do read the instructions on inserting the battery because I could see how it could easily damage the camera if you tried to jam the battery in the wrong way.My favorite thing about this camera is how easy it is to use- just point and click.  There a ton of modes from different lighting (even fireworks, indoors, night), moving objects, close up, panoramic, cool black and white.  I particularly like the panoramic.  The camera has memory of the last picture you took and gives you an outline so you can line up the next shot and if it is still of it has an option to let you retake it to you satisfaction.  My other favorite mode is film grain which is in black and white and has a rough texture that made things look they were in a from a film noir.  I am also pleased with the lighting options and the modes to take action photos that do not blur the photos.  Another fab option is the timer which lets you take a pic 2 or 10 sec later so you can get in the photo, too.  The battery also seems to run for a long time. I have used it off and on for the past 4 days and not had to recharge it yet.  However, I have only been taking about 20 pics each time.However, there we a few things which I did not like about the camera.  The first being that it does not come with a memory card.  It instead has built in memory which amounts to like 12 photos!  And if you take a mini movie forget it, that is pretty much it of your memory.  So I had to go on Amazon an buy a memory card cause you want to take more than 12 photos!  I also bought a carrying case for the camera's extra protection. (another thing I am considering doing is getting an extra battery just in case)  The other thing is that the movie mode has a lot of limitations.  I liked that it also records sound but it is really more for fun since it still a bit primitive.  You can't make adjustments like zoom or change to black and white etc.  That last thing is the lock on the bottom for the memory card and battery is kind of flimsy and I could see where this might break if someone was a bit too forceful.Overall, great quality camera for the price, definitely pleased.UpdateThe camera fell in the sand and never recovered.  Particles of sand got inside and it got stuck and then nothing would respond.  It is not very sturdy and should not be used for rougher outdoor events ike camping etc.
